results.name: Unique fixed point of the 3-symbol Fibonacci morphism phi-hat_2.
comment: Fixed point of the morphism phi-hat_2 given by 1 --> 12, 2 --> 3, 3 --> 12. [_Joerg Arndt_, Apr 10 2016]

This sequence is the [0->12, 1->3]-transform of the Fibonacci word A003849: if T(0):=12, T(1):=3, then one proves easily with induction that T(phi_1^n(0)) = phi-hat_2^{n+1)(1), and T(phi_1^n(1)) = phi-hat_2^{n+1)(2), where phi_1 denotes the Fibonacci morphism given by 0 --> 01, 1 --> 0. - _Michel Dekking_, Dec 29 2019
link: Joerg Arndt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
F. Michel Dekking, Morphisms, Symbolic Sequences, and Their Standard Forms, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 19 (2016), Article 16.1.1.
formula: Let A(n)=floor(n*tau), B(n)=n+floor(n*tau), i.e., A and B are the lower and upper Wythoff sequences, A=A000201, B=A001950. Then a(n)=1 if n=A(A(k)) for some k; a(n)=2 if n=B(k) for some k; a(n)=3 if n=A(B(k)) for some k. - _Michel Dekking_, Dec 27 2016
maple: for n from 1 to 10 do S:=psi(S): od:
xref: Cf. A159917 (same sequence if we map 1->2, 2->0, 3->1).
